entry.title: Mid-Market SaaS Companies: Running SaaS with Cloud Agility vs. Duct-Tape Systems – Best Practice
entry.content:
Are you a rapidly growing SaaS company looking to streamline your operations and scale efficiently?  

Many believe that SAP is only for large enterprises, focused solely on financials, and prohibitively expensive. Let's dispel those myths! 

Introducing SAP Business Suite for Software Providers SAP Business Suite is designed to support the varied lines of businesses within a SaaS company.  

Whether you are: 

  • A CFO  who needs to manage cash flow, budgets, close the books quickly, and provide real-time business visibility to drive strategic decisions. 
  • A CRO looking to manage your sales pipeline, offer flexible monetization models, and expand into new markets while scaling growth. 
  • A CHRO aiming to manage talent effectively, secure the right skills, and foster ongoing talent development. 
  • A COO striving to automate processes, scale efficiently, and integrate siloed departments. 

SAP Business Suite addresses these and more with its innovative business platform. 

Hear from Software Providers Leveraging SAP Cloud ERP: 

  • Leadsquared has automated subscription services with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. 
  • Seralla harmonized data to support robust lead-to-cash and hire-to-retire processes after a swift migration to the Public Cloud. 

Exciting News: New Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software 

We are thrilled to announce the launch of our Industry Best Practice for Subscription Management for Software. We understand the unique challenges you face: 

  • Data Complexity: Digital offerings require flexible setup, unlike physical products. 
  • Sales System Limitations: Evolving go-to-market strategies demand agile packaging and pricing solutions. 
  • Manual Subscription Processes between sales and provisioning: Decoupled processes lead to errors, customer dissatisfaction, and compliance risks. 
  • Revenue Recognition: Non-integrated processes and manual tasks pose compliance threats. 
  • Subscription Changes: Managing changes during the subscription lifecycle can be cumbersome. 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers addresses these issues with integrated capabilities, allowing you to streamline your operations and accelerate growth.  

The latest SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 includes a predefined SAP Best Practice to speed up your adoption. 

And if you are a service or product-centric company that also sells digital assets – you can utilize this SAP Best Practice as well. 

Interested in Learning More? 

  • For Prospects: Enabling sustainable growth for Software Providers 
  • For Existing SAP Customers:  Scope item details on SAP for Me – SAP Signavio Process Explorer 
  • For Partners and SAP Experts: 
  • Webinar 1: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 1 
  • Webinar 2: Scope Item 5SW: Subscription Management for Software – Part 2 
  • For Scaleups – high-growth companies experiencing rapid expansion, growing 20% or more in employee headcount and turnover over the last three years. - Grow with SAP for Scaleups 

 

Take the Next Step Towards Agility and Growth 

SAP Business Suite for Software Providers empowers you to optimize your operations, adapt quickly to market changes, and deliver exceptional customer experiences. Join the C-suite leaders who are embracing SAP's cutting-edge solutions to drive their businesses forward. 

Let's connect and discuss how SAP can transform your SaaS journey!

entry.title: Re: Migration Cockpit: Exclude data from sub structures
entry.content:
Hello Victor,

did you adapt the selection criteria scope in LTMOM? (see screenshot)

The default setting is "Parent and child tables" and means that the selection affects the parent tables. If you left this setting, that could be the cause, why the customers were excluded completely. 

When using the BAdI, the selection criteria scope has the following effect. Only the instances considered relevant in KNB5 are also considered relevant for the parent tables, if you choose "parent and child tables". If you set the selection criteria scope to "Child tables only", then the result set from KNB5 does not propagate upwards.

Please also check 3249988 - Details on selection process - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Direct Transfer - SAP for Me. You will find two documents, which describe the selection process in detail.

With the SKIP rule your requirement cannot be achieved. The SKIP rule exclusively determines "relevant YES/NO" for the entire (!) instance.

I hope this helps to solve your requirement.

Best regards, Kirstin

entry.title: Re: Planning ERP to S4H FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100 Message
entry.content:
When checked in se91 for FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, it shows "&1 &2 &3 &4". This means it’s a generic placeholder message. The actual text is supposed to be filled dynamically at runtime by the program/report (R_FINS_PLANTRANS_CO_ERP_2_S4H). If nothing is passed to those placeholders, you just see the raw &1 &2 &3 &4. So in your case, the report is raising message FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING100, but it isn’t passing any values into the placeholders. That’s why you don’t see a meaningful explanation.

What you can do is run the report again and then check transaction SLG1 with object FINS_ACDOC_PLANNING. Often the detailed log is written there, even if the message text is empty.

Look in table ACDOCP for your controlling area, version, fiscal year. If no records exist, the message may simply mean “no data selected” or “no data transferred.”

entry.title: Re: SAP Digital Manufacturing (DMC) – QA Environment Setup with a Single SAP Cloud Platform Integrat
entry.content:
Thanks @KatjaHuschle  for this interesting blog that helped us set up SAP DM with multi-backend connectivity in our landscape.

We came across one point that is a severe limitation currently, though: The DM-EWM interfaces delivered with DM CPI standard content are not properly multi-backend enabled as described above. It is not possible to dynamically determine S/4 backend connectivity parameters, so that multi-backend connectivity for EWM interfaces only works if and when:

  • S/4 backends are behind the same Cloud Connector
  • S/4 backends share the same client
  • S/4 backend authentication happens through same RFC user ID and password for all backends.

As S/4 embedded EWM is the default warehousing setup for S/4 going foward, this is an important limitation which I want to mention here in the comments. For those interested in a resolution, please support our Improvement Request for the issue. Thanks!

entry.title: Re: How to authorize a CF-deployed HTML5 app via a Conten...
entry.content:
Hi @theodore_abitbol ,

another approach you could go with, is to leverage the CDM exposure via the HTML5 Repository, which is possible in the meantime. This capability allows to add CDM definitions, like roles, spaces & pages to the deployment of your HTML5 app to the HTML5 Repository of BTP. Then, instead of consuming the app directly via the "HTML5 Apps" Content Channel, you can create a dedicated Channel (either a manual "Content Provider" or the newly introduced "HTML5 Business Solution"). With this, not only your HTML5 App is being exposed to SAP Build Work Zone, but also the CDM you included into the deployment.

You can check out the following Blog Post which describes this approach (although its focus is mainly the cross-subaccount consumption): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/simplifying-html5-content-consumption-across-subaccounts/ba-p/13758568

Hope this helps.

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 在会计年度末传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
自动传输通过 SAP-S/4HANA 迁移主控室进行数据转移，要创建新的历史数据传输细分，请在"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用中执行以下步骤：

  1. 打开"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用。
  2. 选择用户计划迁移历史数据的公司代码。
  3. 点击"编辑"按钮。
  4. 在"历史数据转移设置"标签页中点击"创建"按钮。
  5. 指定所需参数或确认默认值：
    ○ 输入转移日期：31.12.XXXX
    ○ 转移状态：正在进行（允许其他过账）
    ○ 凭证类型：资产过账（AA）（根据用户的业务需求选择）
    ○ 如果必要，设置指示器以抑制折旧计算。
    ○ 如有必要，输入注释。
  6. 点击"保存"。

 

迁移数据 - 迁移主控室应用

在打开"固定资产 - 过账模板"后，用户必须填写过账代码表。然后，根据用户的业务需求填写累计值表。

通常导致错误的关键考虑事项包括：

  1. 当前财年：这应该反映当前公司代码设置的最高财年。
  2. 分账特定行项目类型：展开第八行以查看并验证分账的特定行项目类型。

 

客户通常希望转移诸如资产价值和累计折旧的数据。
• 当前财年：2025年
• 历史数据转移日期：2024年12月31日

以下是供参考的示例：

  • • 资产编号：12345678
  • 资产购置价值：1000 CNY
  • 累计折旧价值：-200 CNY

 

填写模板的内容如下：

 

还有许多其他分账特定的行项目类型可供选择。用户可以根据实际业务需求进行选择和填写。

 

参考Help Portal 链接：

在会计年度结束日期传输

固定资产 - 过账

entry.title: Re: About use API to create partial billing document base...
entry.content:
Yes this is a current product limitation of the public cloud APIs. The API does not support interactive item selection or quantity adjustment like the Fiori app. SAP’s official guidance is to handle the splitting logic outside SAP (in middleware or custom logic) and then call the API with the desired quantities.

What that means is if you want to bill partial quantities via API, in your middleware or calling system, decide how much of each delivery item should be billed. Construct the API payload with those quantities (instead of the full delivery quantity). Call the API once for each partial billing you want to create. If you want to split one delivery into multiple billing documents (like you can in the app), you must make multiple API calls, each with a subset of items/quantities.

SAP’s documentation on Billing Document Split and Convergence explains that the system can split billing documents based on split‑relevant fields and user settings in the Create Billing Documents app and this section makes clear that the interactive split/merge logic is part of the app, not the API.

entry.title: Re: Notifications from SAP Build Apps to Work Zone
entry.content:
@kazistov_v From a security point of view, it would discouraged to do it with the approach that you are attempting. Why? The logic you are implementing in SAP Build Apps is executed on the front-end. This means, with your approach you are effectively allowing each and every authenticated user to trigger notifications to any arbitrary receiver of your tenant.

The credentials for the notification service (e.g. via a BTP destination), should not be exposed as a dynamic destination to front-end clients (like your Build Apps application deployed to the HTML5 Repository & SAP Build Work Zone). Instead, the logic for creating notifications and interacting with the notification API should only be done from a "backend" application you deploy to SAP BTP to stay in control of which notifications are sent to which user. Unfortunately this would rather fall under the "pro-code" category. One fairly easy approach would be to leverage CAP (SAP Cloud Application Programming Model), which has a plugin that simplifies sending notifications: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/plugins/#notifications

entry.title: External hyperlink to a text field value in Static Adobe Form
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Greetings..!! Would be of great help to find a solution to this.

Requirement: To make the 'Material Number' field clickable in a Static Adobe form, so that when clicked, it takes the user to the product information page. I tried most of the solutions in the help online, but could not get a solution. A solution that i found and tried - but did not work is: After making the Material text fied as 'Rich Text'

var MaterialNumber = this.parent.MATNR.rawValue; // Get the material number value
var targetURL = "https://abcxyz.com/product-details?c=" + MaterialNumber;

// Build minimal XHTML
var xhtml = '<body xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p>' +
'<a href="' + targetURL + '">' + MaterialNumber + '</a>' +
'</p></body>';

// Push the XHTML into the text object
this.value.exData.loadXML(xhtml, /*bValidate*/false, /*bReconcile*/true);

Anything more that needs to be corrected here?

Best Regards,

Satish DK

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 在会计年度期间传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
自动传输通过 SAP-S/4HANA 迁移主控室进行数据转移，要创建新的历史数据传输细分，请在"对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定"应用中执行以下步骤：

  1. 打开“对公司代码进行设置 - 资产会计特定”应用。
    2. 选择用户计划迁移历史数据的公司代码。
    3. 点击“编辑”按钮。
    4. 在“历史数据转移设置”标签下，按“创建”按钮。
    5. 指定所需参数或确认默认值：
    ○  转移日期：03.15.XXXX（除了财年最后一天的任何一天）
    ○ 转移状态：进行中（允许其他过账） 凭证类型：资产过账（AA）（根据用户的业务需求选择）
    ○ 如果需要，启用指示器以抑制折旧计算。
    ○ 如有必要，输入注释。
    ○ 点击“保存”。

 

财年内的历史数据转移可以分为两种情况：

情况1

财年：2025 年
历史数据转移日期：03.15.2025
用户希望转移与2025年相关的数据

数据输入所需的表格

在进行历史数据转移时，用户需要填写以下四个表格：过账代码表，过账值表，交易抬头表，和交易项目表。

供参考的示例：

资产编号：12345678

资产购置价值：1000 CNY

过账折旧价值：-200 CNY

交易种类详细信息，请参阅：Asset Accounting: Transaction Types.xlsx (SAP Customer)

 

 

情况2：

财年：2025 年
历史数据转移日期：03.15.2025

用户需要转移2025年及之前年份的数据。

数据输入所需的表格：

过账关键字表 累计值表 过账值表

 

供参考的示例：

资产编号：12345678

资产购置价值：1000 CNY

累计折旧价值：-300 CNY

过账折旧价值：-200 CNY

还有许多其他分账特定的行项目类型可供选择。用户可以根据实际业务需求进行选择和填写。

Help Portal Link:

在会计年度期间传输

固定资产 - 过账

entry.title: Re: BOM Component Validation
entry.content: Sir, now I wrote the logic in user exit PCSD0005. my logic for your reference. IF SY-TCODE EQ 'CS01' OR SY-TCODE EQ 'CS02'. DATA : BEGIN OF TAB, IDNRK TYPE STPOB-IDNRK, END OF TAB. DATA : T_TAB LIKE STANDARD TABLE OF TAB WITH HEADER LINE, WA LIKE LINE OF T_TAB. IMPORT T_TAB FROM MEMORY ID 'ZPP'. MOVE: COMPONENT TO WA-IDNRK. IF T_TAB[] IS NOT INITIAL. LOOP AT T_TAB WHERE IDNRK EQ WA-IDNRK. MESSAGE 'SAME COMPONENT NOT ALLOWED ' TYPE 'E'. ENDLOOP. ENDIF. APPEND WA TO T_TAB. " SORTED BY IDNRK. EXPORT T_TAB TO MEMORY ID 'ZPP'. ENDIF. in cs01 its working perfectly, sir. but in cs02, I pass duplicate value it allows to save. I have alternative BOM also, sir. kindly help me

entry.title: Re: Hi Team,
entry.content:
Please note after Release or Partial Confirmation, direct change of cost center is not possible in standard. Some options are

  • Technical completion (TECO) or close the existing orders, then create new orders with the correct cost center.
  • Use manual reposting of costs in Controlling with transactions like KB11N, KB21N, to move already posted costs from the “wrong” cost center to the “correct” one.
  • For future confirmations, you could change the work center master data (CR02) to point to the new cost center, but this only affects new orders created afterwards, not existing ones.

entry.title: Process Order Not Inheriting GI Storage Location from Production Version (PP-PI) S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA (on-premise) in a PP-PI (Process Industries) environment and facing an issue where my process order does not inherit the Goods Issue (GI) storage location for components from the Production Version in the Material List tab.

My setup:

  • In the Production Version, I have maintained both the GR and GI storage locations.

  • When I create a process order using this Production Version:

    • The GR storage location (receiving location) is correctly inherited into the order.

    • The GI storage location for components remains blank and is not inherited.

Additional information:

  • All components are extended to the relevant storage locations.

  • In the BOM, the storage location field is left blank at the component level.

  • In the Material Master (MRP 2 tab), the Issue Storage Location field is also blank.

  • My materials are not assigned to any MRP group 

Business context:

I have two production lines, each represented by a different storage location.

  • Some finished goods can be produced on either line.

  • Initially, I solved this by creating alternative BOMs (one per production line).

  • However, this approach creates unnecessary complexity in master data, as I want to maintain only one BOM per material per plant for engineering purposes and instead control the GI/GR storage location through the Production Version.

What I have checked so far:

  • I read on other SAP forum threads that this behavior could be related to MRP group customizing (transaction OPPQ → Storage location determination).

  • In my system (transaction OPPR), the "Storage location determination" button appears only under Repetitive Manufacturing (REM).

  • Since we are in a PP-PI process, and my materials are not linked to any MRP group, I am unsure whether this configuration is relevant or applicable to my case.

Question:

Is there a way in S/4HANA on-premise to make the process order automatically inherit the GI storage location for components directly from the Production Version, just like it already does for the GR storage location?
Or is there some additional customizing step (e.g., MRP groups or another configuration) required to enable this behavior?

Thank you in advance for your guidance!

#S4/HANA #ONPREMISE #ProductionPlanning #ProcessIndustries

entry.title: Re: Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter
entry.content:
Hi,

After update our PO system 7.50 to stack SP33, we started to get error related to fingerprints...

After doing some tests we set the channel fingerprint in Base64 in that way: SHA256:xxxxxx.... without set in section advanced mode the new parameter useBase64Fingerprint.

So we think that the default value for this parameter is true, at least in 7.50 stack SP33.

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Removeall SAP MDG (MDG_FND , MDG_APPL and other MDG components
entry.content:
Hi Marc, 

In MDG-Implementation, Most MDG business functions are non-reversible. Once activated, they

generally cannot be deactivated without restoring the system from a backup, which is often

impractical. Therefore, it's crucial to be certain about which functions are required for the

implementation scope before activation.

 

Regards.

entry.title: Re: PM Order User Status Reset Once CNF Done.
entry.content:
With the standard functionality, system statuses like CRTD, REL, PCNF, CNF, TECO are set automatically by SAP when you perform business transactions like release, confirmation, or technical completion. User statuses are additive and they don’t get reset by confirmations unless you’ve configured them to do so (e.g. “set/deactivate with business transaction” in the profile). So if your user status is disappearing, it suggests either Custom logic is interfering (user exit, BAdI, enhancement) or data inconsistency in the order status tables (TJ20, JEST).

So what you can do is

  • Run RIORDST1 in test mode to see if your affected orders are flagged as inconsistent. Check SAP Note 67826. This note delivers the standard report RIORDST1, which checks and repairs inconsistencies between system status and user status in PM/CS orders. It’s often the first diagnostic step when you see statuses disappearing or being reset.
  • Review your status profile customizing (SPRO → PM/CS → Maintenance and Service Orders → General Data → User Status for Orders) to confirm no “set/deactivate with business transaction” rules are unintentionally wiping statuses.
  • If none of the above resolves it, raise an OSS incident with SAP Support, referencing the notes above and attaching examples of orders where the reset occurs.

entry.title: Re: Some issues with the SuccessFactors Microsoft Teams integration
entry.content: @Ale_Comsa, just want to confirm whether you want to implement the SuccessFactors Teams App, or are you talking about other CPM integration? As I ee in your provided influence and this is not under our Work Tech - Teams integration, it's under dynamic team. Our supported permission type under Teams App includes both application permission and delegate permission which is listed here - https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/integrating-sap-successfactors-with-microsoft-365/enabling-sap-successfactors-app-for-microsoft-teams . Any further concern from your side?

entry.title: Re: EWM Pinter assignment to packaging material
entry.content:
I am not sure if you mean Print on the Printer (not to have access, because it sounds like authorization topic). So if it is about printer determination for User1 HU with PM 1 should be printed on LP01, User2 + PM1 = LP02, and PM2 should be always printed on the LP03, it could be solved with condition technique but in different ways. If I assume so like you described it, User + PM you can maintain in the condition for PM2 with LP03, and for PM1 without printer, in this case default printer from user record should be taken. If it is not flexible enough, you can use logical Conditions (LCxx), where you maintain for LC01 User1 (or group of users1) and second logical condition with user2 (LC02), and you create 3 records 

  1. PM1 + LC01 = LP01
  2. PM1 + LC02 = LP02
  3. PM2 = LP03 (without logical condition)

entry.title: Re: Cannot access script variable in calculation editor f...
entry.content: It seems your script has syntex errors. In SAC scripting, never type full IDs manually. Instead, place the cursor where x is and type the first letter of the measure or dimension ( for script variable type @ as shown in snapshot. In my snapshot "Filter_var" is script variable) , The editor will show suggestions; pick the right one from the list. This way, the correct ID is inserted automatically and syntax errors are avoided. Write like this: IF(x , , ), ,)  (1)At the place of x, type the first letter of the measure or dimension. (2) The system will show suggestions, then you can pick the correct one. (3) This avoids wrong IDs and syntax errors.

entry.title: Re: Process Order Not Inheriting GI Storage Location from...
entry.content:
For information, the standard SAP logic for GI storage location determination is for components in production/process orders, SAP does not read the GI storage location from the production version. Instead, the system follows a fixed priority sequence:

  • If a storage location is maintained at BOM item level (STPO-LGORT), this is transferred into the order.
  • If no storage location is in the BOM, the system checks the issue storage location (MARC-LGPRO) in the material master.
  • If the component is assigned to an operation, and the work center has a supply area with a storage location, this can override the above.
  • The GI storage location remains blank in the order component list. I believe, this is what you are seeing.
  • Also, please note Production Version in standard only controls GR storage location (header level, for the finished product), BOM/routing selection and Lot size validity. It does not control the GI storage location of components.

So in order to achieve your requirement,

  • Maintain Issue Storage Location in Material Master (MRP 2 tab). Simple, but only one storage location per plant/material. Doesn’t solve your “two lines, two storage locations” case.
  • Assign supply areas to work centers, each with its own storage location. When you assign components to operations, the system can derive the correct GI storage location from the supply area.

entry.title: Re: Structured address data elements in ISO 20022 messages
entry.content:
Hello,
Thanks for the detailed blog post. I would like to raise a question because there seems to be a discrepancy between the dates mentioned here and the official EPC guidance document that is linked in the post (EPC Guideline document).

The EPC document ( page 4/18 clearly states the following timeline for address usage under ISO20022):

 

Period Allowed formatsNot allowed
Until 05 Oct 2025Structured, UnstructuredHybrid
05 Oct 2025 – 22 Nov 2026Structured, Hybrid, Unstructured–
From 22 Nov 2026 onwardsStructured, HybridUnstructured

This means that Unstructured addresses are not phased out in November 2025, but only in November 2026. Also, the Hybrid model remains valid beyond 2026 (no end date defined).

Could you please clarify why the blog mentions November 2025 as the end date for unstructured addresses, while the official EPC guidance extends it until November 2026?

Thanks in advance for your clarification.

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Cloud Can't Assign Extensions
entry.content:
Dear Boonthep,

Please go to the presentation server, go windows services manager, and check the "SAP Business One Client Agent" is correctly configured and started. See SAP Note 1764311 for your reference.

After that please restart SAP Business One Client Agent services on all Presentation servers assigned to corresponding service unit (S90) and try to deploy Extension again.
 After deploying an extension to a service unit, you can assign the extension to tenants.
 
For more information please follow chapters from Administrator's Guide - SAP Business One Cloud:
 
9.4 Deploying Extensions
9.5 Assigning Extensions
 
I hope this helps.
 
Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Approach for a multi-site customer service
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes, I know that in customersupportbackoffice-backoffice-config.xml is where the UI permissions are defined, but they are set for the roles customersupportadministratorrole, customersupportmanagerrole, and customersupportagentrole.

So a user with customersupportagentrole will always see, for example, the same fields and the same tabs in the Customers, Orders, etc. views.

The question is: if I want, in some cases, them to see certain fields and in other cases different fields depending on the site. Suppose site1 and site2.

With SiteEmployeeGroup that has a site attribute, I can make them see only the orders from site1 or site2.

But if I also want them, in the Orders view, to see different fields or different tabs depending on the site, that’s the question. I can’t do it with just customersupportagentrole; I would need to have site1customersupportagentrole and site2customersupportagentrole, and it doesn’t seem like there is inheritance in UI permissions.

That is, if site1customersupportagentrole and site2customersupportagentrole were members of customersupportagentrole, it doesn’t seem to work; it seems I would have to create those roles from scratch.

Best regards

entry.title: Calling bound RAP action from CAP / Node.js backend with OData V4
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am trying to call a bound RAP Action from a CAP backend and am running into some issues with the namespace that comes with the service beeing OData V4. 

As described in the CAP documentation I tried the following syntax:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: 'final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

 This returns an error because the ressource can't be found. As to be expected, because OData V4 action calls need the namespace added as a prefix. The rest of the call looks totally fine.

If I adapt the code to include the namespace, it looks like this:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: '<MyNamespace>.final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

The request fails again - with error:  URI has a slash as last character
This is the result from the the call URI not beeing build correctly. It looks something like this:

/sap/opu/odata4/.../<MyEntity/

The ID is not passed to the URI anymore, so the intance is not called, as well as the actual action call that is missing completely.

Did anyone experience the same behavior?

Note: I got it to work by building the request myself:

let response = await external_service.send({
   method: 'POST',
   headers: {
      "If-Match": '*'
   },
   path: `/<MyEntity>(${id})/<MyNamespace>.final_approval`,
   data: { 
       username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
       reason: ''
   },
})

Thanks in advance!
Best regards,
Lukas

entry.title: Re: Supplier specific number range for ERS invoices
entry.content:
Hello Raf,

coming late on this topic : the flow ERS Vendor Invoice Numbering as described by notes 684514 & 571376  +  blog :https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/key-customization-to-enable-vendor-specific-number-range-in-self-billing/ba-p/13247335
works on S4H with BP "instead" of Vendors as well.

The key point is to be able to maintain the field "LFA1-STCD4" with theVendor new numbering group  code defined in number range J_1AOFFDOC « Official Documents ».
To do this, you need to maintain Tax NB 4 in BP - FI supplier role "FLVN00" - for tab Indentification.

For example for a vendor in France : that would be Category Tax "FR4" which will lead to field LFA1-STCD4.
If the Tax Catefory is not present for your country : you are missing BP customizing : please see link https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/74b0b157c81944ffaac6ebc07245b9dc/05a5afc94d844866be6a8a273b6d35f0.html

 

Hope this helps.

Stephane

entry.title: Re: MIGO ITEM ADD NEW FIELD
entry.content: You cannot directly add a field to MIGO item tabs. So what you can do is use BAdI MB_MIGO_BADI to create a custom subscreen at item level. You can choose an existing tab (General/Where/Quantity) or create a new tab. Handle data persistence via append structures or Z-tables.

entry.title: Re: when i data migration one tenant to other tenant in c...
entry.content: When you migrated user data, the new tenant's identity management system likely recognized the users and automatically provisioned them with single sign-on (SSO) and default roles. This is a common feature in many enterprise applications, where user creation or migration triggers automated provisioning processes to ensure users can log in seamlessly and have the necessary initial access rights. The specific SSO and role assignments are typically determined by the tenant's predefined configuration or the data imported during migration.

entry.title: Re: Client Certificate Authentication in SAP Cloud Integration: Configuration and Best Practices

What i understood is keytype "External Certificate" should be chosen when Client gives us the certificate from their side.

In this case, while creating service key,  In External Certificate field, as per my understanding we need to give the Key "(e.g -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----MIIHyDCCBrCgAwIB[...]CAq8Tn7kSFDmVnrXe6v8hcQ==-----END CERTIFICATE-----)" and then create the service key.

Additionally, in HTTPS Adapter, we need to change the auth from user role to Client certificate and upload the root certificate which client will provide.

Additionally, assumption would be that the same certificate will be already added in client's SAP system using STRUST.
If not then they should create new Client PSE and then import their own certificate along with the Load balancer certificates which we downloaded from Cloud Integration.

And then we create RFC with the required host and path and then choose the appropriate SSL certificate from the dropdown.

Is my understanding correct?

Regards,

Bishal

entry.title: Re: How to avoid FX distortions in production order varia...
entry.content: S/4HANA Public Cloud mitigates the FX distortion not by changing the transactional posting logic, but by capturing costs in multiple currencies at the point of entry (via the Material Ledger) and providing advanced analytical tools to report on that data in the currency that makes sense for the audience. This allows a single controlling area to effectively serve both corporate consolidation and local operational control needs

entry.title: Re: How to Mass maintain long texts in SAP S4 HANA Public...
entry.content:
Yes, SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud offers several solutions and APIs for mass updating long texts, memos and notes in various business objects, including real state contracts. the recommended approach is to use the available OData APIs or SAP Build Process Automation to achieve mass upload and update functionality for long text IDs and contract memos. 

API solutions for Mass Updating

OData APIs: SAP provides batch APIs that allow updating multiple long text in a single request. for example, the  MsrmDocumentLongText entity supports batch processing, where you can send multiple updates for long text field in one go using the multiple batch OData protocol.

Reference link: Link1

Reference link: Link2

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error when using the new App...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn

Thank you for clarifying. Let us go through the points you raised.

Even when you only activate editing in Excel, the program may silently alter the XML structure. I suggest testing wit a completely untouched XML file exported directly and uploaded back again. If the raw export fails again, then Excel did not cause the issue.

The import without source system option exist to support standalone imports. In practice, however, certain bugs have been reported where the app still expects a source system reference. If you want to rule this out, try defining a dummy source system in the communication management app and re-test. Import Master Data - Business Partners (New)

In regard to your file size, this can be excluded as not the problem. Also, considering you have tested with multiple browsers, this suggests to be a backend import job failing immediately and re-triggering.

I recommend to

  • Carry out the unmodified import and export.
  • If it still fails define the dummy source as mentioned and test without the checkbox.
  • Should the flickering persist in both cases, there is likely a bug in your tenant. You should raise an incident with SAP.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Journal Document upload Error
entry.content:
Hello @JackN11 

Thank you for your follow up question. Let me clarify.

See the following link for more details: Integration and Configuration Options. However, the default storage category is DMS-C1_ST for storing attachments. It is preconfigured in public cloud tenants and mapped to the DMS backend.

In regard to verifying your content repository in DMS, you can check this:

  • In your SAP BTP Cockpit, navigate to your subaccount where the cloud tenant is subscribed. Locate the DMS, under instances and subscriptions, you should see the configured repository bound to your tenant.
  • Within the public cloud, you can also test by opening the Manage Documents Fiori app à create/upload a document. If the repository is active, the document will be stored successfully. If missing then contact SAP support to activate it.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Set WarnOnConnection and WarnOnAttach for all users
entry.content:
Hello 

Unfortunately, this registry key is only available for the HKEY_CURRENT_USER hive. 

From the SAP GUI Administration guide page 70, it states 

WarnOnConnection
REG_DWORD
1
only HKCU

entry.title: Re: Let the Gamification Begin!
entry.content:
Hi @jerryjanda , 

The Community rank ladder is a very good tool that motivates users. I was excited when my rank moved from Member to Participant.

However, for more than a year my rank has not changed from Participant to Active Participant, even though I am actively contributing in the Q&A sections.

Could you please check and let me know the reason?

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Re: Set WarnOnConnection and WarnOnAttach for all users
entry.content: Good to know, thanks!

entry.title: How to change the posting date of schedule supplier invoice job ERS?
entry.content:
Dear Community,

When we schedule supplier invoice job for ERS, the posting date is always the job running date, is there any settings to change this posting date?

Background; At the beginning of Sep., we found missing posting for some goods receipt, we posted the goods receipt, and change the posting date to Aug., and want to post the invoice in Aug. as well, to align the goods receipt and invoice postings in the same period.

Seems we cannot use "create supplier invoice" to manually create such kind of invoice, because in the PO and supplier master data, it has already set as ERS related.

Is there any solution for changing the posting date of invoice? 

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Grace
